result.execSummary:
The defendant Cynthia J Ford was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Violate/Harassment Restraining Order, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 813.125(7).
  • Resisting an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  This applies to all counts and financial obligations.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  Pay supervision fees.  Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by your agent, which may include: alcohol/drug, anger management/DV counseling, psychiatric/psychological, AODA Assessment and follow-through with recommended treatment. 
++ Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.  If unpaid financial obligations remain at discharge or revocation, civil judgment to be entered.
++  Defendant is ordered to submit to a DNA sample & pay DNA surcharge and notice is given.  May Not have contact with Steve R, Lori L, Eric L or their residences th Ave Kenosha,  (within 4 blocks),  or place of employment at Jonson Controls 8015 60th St  West Allis, WI 53214. St Joes's School.  Comply with all orders in 15-CV-1597

timeConds.notes: With huber.Unless work crew is expressly prohibited by the Court, an inmate serving time as a condition of probation is eligible for work crew and may receive a credit of one day for every 3 days of work performed.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Cynthia J Ford

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Attorney Jason Zapf appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney Lauren Breckenfelder.  The court orders 60 days KCJ as of 11/15/16 as a condition of probation.  Clerk D. Smith.
Review hearing on December 14, 2016 at 09:00 am.
Conditions of Probation Imposed by the Judge

Attorney Jason Zapf appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney Lauren Breckenfelder.  Clerk/S. Garcia.  Atty Breckenfelder withdraws her motion to withdraw as counsel.  The defendant pleads guilty to count 1 and no contest to count 2.  The court finds the defendant guilty of counts 1 and 2.  The state moves to amend the date of the offense in count 2 to 11/25/16; so ordered.  On count 1 the defendant is sentenced to 120 days jail, STAYED; the defendant is placed on probation for 24 months w/conditions.  On count 2 the defendant is sentenced to 4 months jail, STAYED; the defendant is placed on probation for 24 months w/conditions concurrent with count 1.  If revoked, the sentence in count 2 is consecutive to count 1.  As a condition of probation, the court sentences the defendant to 10 days Kenosha County Jail w/Huber; the defendant is to report on 10/22/16 @ 8:00 a.m; costs ordered to be paid during probation.  Bond applied to costs and if there is a remainder, it can be returned to poster.  Defendant is ordered to submit a DNA sample; written notice provided to defendant.
No contact with Steve R., Lori L, E.L. or their residences (specifically not to be within 4 blocks of their residences), St. Joe's School in Kenosha, and Johnson Controls 801 S. 60th Street, West Allis, WI 53214
At the request of ADA Jason Zapf, plea & sentencing on 9/14/16 at 2:30 is adj. to 9/30/16 at 9:30.  No objection by Atty Breckenfelder or Judge Bastianelli.
Plea/sentencing hearing on September 14, 2016 at 02:30 pm.

Attorney Thomas Binger appeared for the State. Defendant, Cynthia J Ford, appeared with Attorney Lauren Jane Breckenfelder.  Clerk: PT
Case is not resolved at this time and parties stipulate to joining 15CM1600 and 16CM748 for trial.  Scheduling Order is given to parties.  Jury status hearing scheduled for September 1, 2016 at 01:00 pm.  Jury trial scheduled for September 6, 2016 at 08:30 am.
FPT rescheduled to 6/23/16 at 10:20 AM and Atty Breckenfelder to provide notice to the Defendant.
Court has reviewed and approves Atty Breckenfelders request for adjournment with no objection by the State.
Email correspondence received from Atty Breckenfelder requesting to reschedule hearing on 6/3/16 due to a medical appointment she has.

Attorney Thomas Binger appeared for the State. Defendant, Cynthia J Ford, appeared with Attorney Lauren Jane Breckenfelder.  Clerk: PT
Atty Breckenfelder states DE has new pending charges and requests an adjournment for a global resolution; no objection by the State.  Court conducts initial appearance in 16CM478.  Atty Breckenfelder requests a DA Pre-Trial and FPT.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 6, 2016 at 01:30 pm.  Final pre-trial scheduled for June 3, 2016 at 09:40 am.

Attorney Thomas Binger appeared for the State.  Def. appeared with Atty Lauren Breckenfelder.  Clerk K. Zirbel.  Atty Breckenfelder requests time to speak with def.'s immigration attorney, review the digital evidence, and discuss the State's plea offer with def.  FPT adj. to 4/21/16 at 8:40.  Bond continued.
No disposition. Leave on for next scheduled court activity.

CONTINUED POSTED
  *No Contact w/Steven R or his residence.
813.125(7) -Violation of Injunction - Harassment   946.41(1) -Resisting an Officer

1:57 pm    Attorney Carli McNeill appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney Carmen Lassiter.  Clerk:  JT.  Plea of not guilty entered.  Deft demands jury trial.  PTC 1-22-16 @ 1:40 & FPT 2-17-16 @ 8:50.  $800 cash bond contd posted with conditions.   ./dls
And demand for discovery - field by ADA J Krejcarek.
and witness list filed by the State
